metadata.name: AWS STS AssumeRole Misuse
metadata.comment: Identifies the suspicious use of AssumeRole. Attackers could move laterally and escalate privileges.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM user_access WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(actor.user.type) = lower('assumedrole') AND lower(actor.process.session.issuer) = lower('role'))

output.summary: Identifies the suspicious use of AssumeRole. Attackers could move laterally and escalate privileges.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. AssumeRole may be done by a system or network administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. 2. AssumeRole from unfamiliar users or hosts should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. 3. Automated processes that uses Terraform may lead to false positives. References: https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules/pull/1214, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole.html
